title: Drippy rough brush script "Reservoir"
content:
Looking for an ID on this, probably custom or hand-drawn, brush Script.

I just love it when client’s loose their native files.

Thanks for any leads!

 [‹ (x) Classic serif face on David J. Schultz business card - ITC Berkeley Oldstyle {Jazzy B}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062200/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42046 "Go to previous forum topic") [Couple of Font ID requests.... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062200/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42037 "Go to next forum topic")
author: dali137

comments.content: alright, I gave it an hour, anyone got a good substitute. The main features that work for this font in this design at the drippy roughness and the motion implied. It will be used in a fly fishing design.

almost forgot, as usual, free is better as I have no budget...

I found  
Jane Austen  
 [http://www.dafont.com/jane-austen.font?text=Reservoir](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062200/http:/www.dafont.com/jane-austen.font?text=Reservoir "http://www.dafont.com/jane-austen.font?text=Reservoir")

so far.

<cite>anyone got a good substitute</cite>

Hi Casey,  
have a look at:  
 [P22 Cézanne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062200/http:/www.p22.com/products/cezanne.html)  
 [AVP Norwich](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aviation/norwich/)  
 [Secret Scrypt](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062200/http:/www.canadatype.com/showfont.php?id=17)

F

I checked the Antique handwriting (Part 10) section in the Script Font ID Guide, and also checked MyFonts for ’old script’. I think [Gauguin](http://web.archive.org/web/20081119062200/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/p22/gauguin/) was the most similar to me. At least for these letters. I agree with Florian that Secret Scrypt is another similar style.

That suggests that this is either an amateur script ( the joins are rather poor), and/or a custom font, because it looks like a font (based on identical-looking duplicate letters).

- Mike Yanega
I realized that for all your work I never remember to thank you all for coming to my aid with my font IDs... thanks so much!
